Class SendEmail

java.lang.Object
  SendEmail

public class SendEmail
extends java.lang.Object

The SendEmail class uses the javax.mail API. The class constructs and sends an email notification.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Stephanie Derosier

Constructor Summary
SendEmail(EmailNotification not, java.lang.String sEmail, java.lang.String sPassword, java.util.ArrayList<Recipient> rList, java.lang.String pMessage)
          Creates an instance of a SendEmail object.
 
Method Summary
 void Send()
          Send email notification to recipients in list from sender's email address.

Constructor Detail

SendEmail

public SendEmail(EmailNotification not,
                 java.lang.String sEmail,
                 java.lang.String sPassword,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Recipient> rList,
                 java.lang.String pMessage)
Creates an instance of a SendEmail object. Sender and recipient information passed to constructor and assigned to class data members.

Defines connection properties for email and calls method to construct email message.

Parameters:
not - Workspace plugin instance
sEmail - Sender's email as String
sPassword - Sender's password as decrypted String
rList - List of email notification recipients
pMessage - Personal message from sender
Method Detail

Send

public void Send()
Send email notification to recipients in list from sender's email address.

This method creates a javax.mail session, constructs the email message containing all parts of email, and sends email notification to all recipients. If an exception is thrown, a SendErrorGUI object will be created to get input from the user on how to precede.

Throws:
javax.mail.MessagingException - Throws MessagingException in case of send error
